name: EU-China Economics and Politics Institute
goal: The EU-China Economics and Politics Institute is designed to encourage, improve and strengthen EU-China relations, and to extend communication and cooperation as an independent think-tank. Currently the EU-China Economics and Politics Institute cooperates with Webster University (Athens Campus) in Master Programme for the EU-China Relations, and the summer school for EU-China Relations. Furthermore the EU-China Economics and Politics Institute maintains cooperation with Skoda University and Faculty of Social Science of the Charles University in Prague. Annually the EU-China Economics and Politics Institute organizes the EU-China Policy Talk Seminar and the Issues and Studies International Conference. Last but not least, the EU-China Economics and Politics Institute eyes on Kosovo situation and starts to cooperate with Chamber of Commerce, Kosovo to organize the Kosovo Forum to promote Kosovo economy.
interests: Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Enterprise, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Research and Technology, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives: Foreign policy, defence policy, trade and business policy, EU-China Relations, culture, education
